meanings.definition: The act of imitating or mimicking someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her apery of the teacher's gestures was spot on.
meanings.sent2: His apery of famous actors always made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's apery of a famous politician had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The child's apery of a monkey swinging from tree to tree was impressive.
meanings.sent5: She practiced her apery of animal sounds to entertain her little brother.

meanings.definition: A place where apes are kept.
meanings.sent1: The apery at the zoo had a large enclosure for the gorillas.
meanings.sent2: Visitors were excited to see the apery's newest baby chimpanzee.
meanings.sent3: The apery staff organized a special feeding time for the orangutans.
meanings.sent4: The apery's resident silverback gorilla was a favorite among visitors.
meanings.sent5: The apery had a conservation program to protect endangered ape species.

meanings.definition: The behavior or characteristics of an ape.
meanings.sent1: His apery when he's angry is similar to a gorilla pounding its chest.
meanings.sent2: The researcher studied the apery of chimpanzees in the wild.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's apery of a playful monkey brought smiles to everyone around.
meanings.sent4: The actor's apery of a wise old orangutan was praised by critics.
meanings.sent5: The apery of the baby baboon was endearing to all who visited the sanctuary.
